applicant_types: charitable organisations; registered charities; civil society organisations
beneficiary_focus: marginalised communities in London; communities facing inequality and injustice; Londoners; frontline service users in London
funding_range: Not stated for future programmes; previous grants have varied widely
restrictions: Funding is only for work benefiting people in Greater London; Applications from outside London are not eligible; Current funding programmes are closed until autumn 2025
notes: New funding policy 'Standing with Londoners' will launch new programmes in autumn 2025. Only organisations delivering direct benefit to Londoners will be eligible. Social investment fund (Â£22m) may be available but is also focused on London.
evidence: City Bridge Foundation's funding is explicitly for organisations working to benefit people in Greater London. Ellenor Hospice is based in Kent and serves Dartford, Gravesham, Swanley, and Bexley, but not London boroughs. All funding programmes are currently closed to new applications, with the next round expected in autumn 2025. The new funding policy, 'Standing with Londoners', continues to focus exclusively on London and Londoners. There are no indications that organisations outside London, or those whose primary beneficiaries are outside London, will be eligible. Therefore, ellenor Hospice is not eligible for current or upcoming City Bridge Foundation funding.
